item.title: Getting Started
item.description: System requirements macOS 11 Big Sur or later Installation Download dmg file from here. Open a downloaded dmg file. Move Tinkle.app into Applications. Open Tinkle from Launchpad. Accessibility Access dialog will be shown. Click the Open System Settings button. (Tinkle uses the accessibility features in order to detect the focused window changes.) Enable Tinkle on System Settings > Privacy & Security > Accessibility. Finished! A visual effect is shown when you change the focused window while Tinkle is running.

item.title: How to quit Tinkle
item.description: Tinkle keeps running in the background even if you close Settings. To quit Tinkle, choose “Quit Tinkle” from menu bar. Note If you’ve hidden the menu bar icon, you can also quit Tinkle from Settings. Open Settings. Press Quit Tinkle button.

item.title: Open Settings
item.description: Open Settings from menu bar. Note If you’ve hidden the menu bar icon, open Tinkle again from Launchpad while Tinkle is already running to open Settings.

item.title: Effect configuration
item.description: You can change the effect. Open Settings. Choose the effect. Effects Neon (blue) Shock wave (blue) Line (blue)

item.title: How to uninstall Tinkle
item.description: Remove Tinkle from your system as follows. Quit Tinkle before uninstallaion. Open Applications folder in Finder, then move Tinkle to trash.

item.title: Downgrade to older version
item.description: Download an older version from Release notes and install it.

item.title: Open at login
item.description: You can launch Tinkle automaticaly at login. Open Settings. Enable Open at login.

item.title: Hide the icon in menu bar
item.description: You can hide the icon in menu bar from Settings. Open Settings. Turn off Show icon in menu bar.

item.title: Use beta version
item.description: You can install beta version from Check for beta updates button on Misc tab.

item.title: Pricing
item.description: Tinkle is an open source software and you can use it without any purchases.
